title: Myleene Klass' newborn baby Apollo is on an adorable exotic holiday
text:
Myleene’s bubba has an active social life already (Picture: BACKGRID)

Myleene Klass took her adorable newborn baby Apollo on holiday and they are having the best time.

The presenter shared a cute snap of her holding her son Apollo – who looks very confused – during his very first holiday.

She captioned the photo: ‘Baby buoy’ along with an anchor.

The 41-year-old was over the moon as she held onto her two-month-old son while sitting on a boat that overlooked a gorgeous view of a crystal clear ocean and rocky cliffs.

Not only has little Apollo experienced an exotic holiday, but the baby has also been to his first ballet, been to work with mum and even his big sister Ava’s eighth-grade practice.

Cultured baby is more cultured than us all already.

Friends and fans were quick to comment with their best puns about the little one’s holiday.

Apollo’s ready for a nap on the beach (Picture: @myleeneklass/Instagram)

Her daughters Ava and Hero were enjoying their time in the ocean (Picture: @myleeneklass/Instagram)

One user commented: ‘Water lucky boy,’ while another wrote: ‘He’s a lucky buoy’ along with a heart and sun emoji.

Meanwhile, Myleene was recently trolled for putting ‘pressure’ on new mums after sharing a snap of herself breastfeeding her six-week-old son in work on 10 September.

The former model posted a photo of herself nursing Apollo during her 10am to 2pm radio presenting slot at Smooth FM on Saturday, alongside the caption ‘#workingmamas’.

Some of her followers hit back in the comments, accusing her of setting unrealistic standards for when mothers should return to work.

One wrote: ‘I’m not sure how I personally feel about this.. It puts new mums under pressure I feel. Being a mother to a newborn is pressure enough. But work after 6 weeks?’

Another added: ‘Your little boy is lovely and I am thrilled for you. But back at work at six weeks, give it a rest!!!!

Apollo is bringing home the bacon (Picture: Myleene Klass/Instagram)

‘You’re really not helping us Mums with normal, real jobs! Tell it like it is Myleene, it’s all a wee bit s**t in the beginning!’

A third user asked, ‘Why are you not taking maternity leave?’ while a fourth suggested, ‘You should be off work with your baby for a little while to bond & not worry about work.’

However, many of the mum-of-three’s fans rushed to her defence and slammed her critics for being ‘judgemental’.

‘Hat off to you myleene! This baby is her third so she knows what she is doing. If she didn’t feel up to working I’m sure she wouldn’t need to,’ a fan insisted.
